arm_group.description:
Placebo(for Theophylline sustained-release tablet) tablet by mouth 100mg every 12hours for 24weeks.
Inhaled Formoterol-budesonide combined treatment 4.5µg/160µg every 12hours for 24weeks.

Theophylline sustained-release tablet by mouth 100mg every 12hours for 24weeks.
Inhaled formoterol-budesonide combined treatment 4.5µg/160µg every 12hours for 24weeks.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine the efficacy and safety of 24 weeks treatment with
      theophylline plus low-dose formoterol-budesonide in subjects with bronchiectasis.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Theophylline Plus Low-dose Formoterol-budesonide in Treatment of Bronchiectasis

detailed_description.textblock:
Non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis is an orphan disease caused by the pathogenic vicious
      circle including infection, inflammation and airway repair. Today's principle of treatment
      is to break the cycle of inflammation and infection. Nowadays, most clinical trials are
      anti-infective treatment by antibiotics trying to break this cycle by reducing the bacterial
      load, which may cause bacterial resistance. There were still some anti-inflammation trials
      by using inhaled corticosteroids(ICS). Tsang and Martínez-García showed that inhaled
      corticosteroids reduced IL-1,IL-8 levels and sputum inflammation cells, and improved sputum
      volume as well as quality of life, though the corticosteroid must be high dose or medium
      dose combined with long-acting ß2 adrenergic agonists. As described in asthma and chronic
      obstructive pulmonary disease(COPD), theophylline can improve the activity of histone
      deacetylase (HDAC) and then enhanced the anti-inflammatory effect of steroids. We hypothesis
      that theophylline may have the same effect in subjects with bronchiectasis. Theophylline
      plus inhaled low-dose formoterol-budesonide may improve quality of life and reduce airway
      inflammation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients between 18-70 years old with non-cystic fibrosis(CF) bronchiectasis, free
             from acute exacerbations for at least 3 months.Stable phase of the disease.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with a cigarette smoking history of more than 10 packs-year. Patients with
             COPD. Patients with traction bronchiectasis due to advanced fibrosis. Patients with
             known intolerance for theophylline. Patients with asthma. Patients with other disease
             disturbing outcomes of the trials. Patients without consent.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
State Key Laboratory of Respiratory Research Institute.

clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Theophylline Plus Low-dose Formoterol-budesonide in Treatment of Bronchiectasis

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Assessment with St George's Respiratory Questionnaire(SGRQ) and Leicester Cough Questionnaire(LCQ)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

secondary_outcome.description: Exacerbations defined by persistent (≥ 24 h) deterioration in at least three respiratory symptoms, including cough, dyspnea, hemoptysis, increased sputum purulence or volume, chest pain (with or without fever).
secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of exacerbations per patient per 24 weeks
Changes of sputum characteristics from baseline to 24 weeks
Changes of 24 hour sputum volume from baseline to 24 weeks
Changes of forced expiratory volume in 1 second(FEV1) from baseline to 24 weeks
Changes of mean forced expiratory flow between 25% and 75% of the FVC(FEF25-75)from baseline to 24 weeks
Changes of forced vital capacity(FVC) from baseline to 24 weeks
Changes of peak expiratory flow(PEF) from baseline to 24 weeks
Induced sputum cytology count
Changes of sputum culture from baseline to 24 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Test IL-6 both in blood and sputum.
secondary_outcome.measure: IL-6

secondary_outcome.description: Test IL-8 both in blood and sputum.
secondary_outcome.measure: IL-8

secondary_outcome.description: Test IL-10 both in blood and sputum.
secondary_outcome.measure: IL-10

secondary_outcome.description: Test TNF-α both in blood and sputum.
secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor necrosis factor(TNF)α

secondary_outcome.description: HDACs are extracted from cells in blood.
secondary_outcome.measure: Activity of histone deacetylase(HDAC)

secondary_outcome.description: HATs are extracted from cells in blood.
secondary_outcome.measure: Activity of histone acetyltransferase(HAT)
8-Isoprostane
Neutrophilic granulocytes in blood routine examination
White blood cells in blood routine examination
Monocytes in blood routine examination
Eosinophilic granulocytes in blood routine examination

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events may contain symptoms such as nausea, sickness, headache, insomnia, palpitation, arrhythmia and so on. Record the symptoms and times of the patients.
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability

secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was taken for plasma theophylline at the end of the treatment period. (At the very time of 2 hours after patients taken the pills)
secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Theophylline

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
